content:
Shillong is a popular destination for nature lovers and offers numerous scenic hikes. Here are some of the most popular hikes:

1. Elephant Falls: The hike to Elephant Falls passes through a dense forest with a beautiful view of the waterfalls. The total trail length is around 3 km, and the hike can take up to 2 hours. 2. David Scott Trail: This is a popular trekking trail that takes you through the lush pine forests of the East Khasi Hills. The trail is approximately 16 km long and can take up to 6 hours to complete. 3. Mawphlang Sacred Grove: This is a dense forest with several streams and waterfalls. The trail is around 3 km long and can take up to 2 hours. 4. Shillong Peak: This is the highest peak in Shillong and offers a breathtaking view of the surrounding hills and valleys. The hike is around 10 km long and can take up to 4 hours. 5. Umiam Lake: The hike around Umiam Lake offers stunning views of the lake and the surrounding hills. The hiking trail is approximately 8 km long and can take up to 3 hours. These are some of the most popular hikes in Shillong. However, there are many more to explore depending on your level of experience, fitness level and preference. Make sure to consult your guide and do your research before deciding on a hiking trail.
